intro: Phyteuma betonicifolium f. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. This variety is distinguished by its reduced pubescence compared to other forms of Phyteuma betonicifolium.
